You stupid, stupid shits. Yes, it will help stuttering, but the ONLY file that will help is the ProcessManager.xml. Two values have been changed. That is all. The other files are exactly the same as the crack you've already been using. Once applying this, the game will run using a single core. The problem has NOT been solved, it has just been helped. Had ghost19 not been a complete fuckwit about labeling this as from RELOADED, this could have been considered a service. As such, he's just an asshole.
hidden VIRUS!

THIS IS FAKE! Want proof ? See Arcania.exe details, it says "File version 1.0.0.0". 
Real working crack will say "File version v1.1.0.1385".

All this is  type="Gothic4Process"  thread-pool-bit="2" was changed to  type="Gothic4Process"  thread-pool-bit="1

in the processmanager.xml

So if you had video stuttering problems, this should of fixed it. 

I believe it disables the second core of the CPU, if you have a slow dual core CPU the frame rate might not be enough. 

You will notice the difference straight away if you had the video stuttering issues, if not you might see a frame rate decrease. 

It could be that different processor's react differently to the exe and other might not have the stuttering issue, just slow performance.

YEEEAH, I GOT THE SOLUTION! You need to edit the ProcessManager.xml, but that's only half of the truth. In the ProcessManager.xml, you have to set each and every value for "memory synchronized" to true. That's 14 times or so. Next you have to find the line with "ThreadConfig platform="PC" cores="4", and set the cores to the number your CPU has.
NOW the important part:
- Start Arcania
- Load a game or start a new
- Now, open the windows Task-Manager by pressing [Ctrl]+[Shift]+[ESC]
- Find the Arcania.exe-Process
- Now, you have to right-click on Arcania.exe and select "Select affiliation" (I think it is called this in English, it's the third point from bottom, where you can select the cores the process uses)
- Now, disable all cores beside of "CPU 0"
- Get back into Arcania (just activate the window)
- Another important part: Now you have to enable all the cores again
- There you have it, much more fluent
